fields.name: Request package inclusion
fields.content:
This form is meant for registration of golang projects whose package name does not start with "golang-" prefix, i.e. docker, kubernetes, runc. etc. Normally, automatic scans are run periodically on registered golang packages. Scans are designed to discover API backward incompatibilities, to create a dependency graph of golang projects packages and to collect other information that can be used to detect various issues which does not make the golang ecosystem healthy enough. If you register your project, you can benefit from the scans and be informed about updates of your project's dependencies (API breakages, new symbols, depricated packages, etc.) or about changes and recommended updates in your spec files.
To register your project please fill in your email, project's homepage (github.com, bitbucket.org, ...) and package name. In "Review request text" field you can provide additional information about the package (regular changes in API, active upstream, under development, etc.) or ask questions about scans. Your input and feedback is welcomed.

fields.name: Review spec file
fields.content: If you are not sure whether your spec file contains all necessary data, macros or if there is something else you can extend your spec file with, don't hesitate to contact us. We will try to provide you a feedback and help with advanced features (i.e. support for secondary architectures, CI/unit-test testing, macros for automatic updates, etc.). To get a help from us, please fill the form.

fields.name: About
fields.content:
This web was designed to centralize golang packaging effort and provide useful statistics for golang developers and package maintainers. It uses gofed tool in order to analyze and summarize statistics. Source codes of gofed-web and gofed are available on github.com.

Main point of contacts and credits go to:
  • Jan Chaloupka - mainly gofed
  • Fridolín Pokorný - mainly gofed-web and gofed client
If you have some questions or suggestions, do not hesitate to contact us (we don't bite... usually :-) ).

gofed-web - centralizing golang packaging
